title: How to Set Up $3 Million for Lifelong Payoff
subtitle: A strategy focused on dividend income and liquidity for a secure retirement.
content:
How to Set Up $3 Million for Lifelong Payoff

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free, so you don't have to pay for it.

1. $2 Million in Custom-Built Dividend Portfolio

This would consist of about 30 stocks spread across sectors such as healthcare, utilities, and consumer staples. This approach limits business risk while collecting 3-4% annually. Plus, I wouldn’t have to pay a company to manage the funds for me.

2. $500,000 in a Blue-Chip Dividend ETF or Index Fund

Investing this amount in funds like SCHD, VIG, or DGRO provides additional exposure to high-quality dividend growers that might not be in my custom portfolio. It also serves as a benchmark, allowing me to compare my portfolio's performance against professional funds.

3. $300,000 in Broad Index Fund

I would allocate $300,000 to a fund like VTI because, even in retirement, I need growth, not just dividends, to outpace inflation.

4. $200,000 in Money Market Fund

This will go into a fund like SPAXX or SGOV, which pays around 4-5% and provides a buffer against inevitable market volatility.

Altogether, this strategy would generate around $120,000 in interest and dividends annually. Plus, I could always sell a small slice of the VTI each year for a little extra cash.
